The Jardin des Plantes is not just a beautiful park that is well kept, it offers some unexpected views as well. The designs of the park benches as you walk through are fun to try and makes it a real tourist attraction, not just a park.
nice gardens and plenty of fun for kids around. enjoyed to walk here. there is a good bar and cafeteria too next to the playground. Overall nice place to visit.

It’s a nice stroll around these lovely gardens. Great for families with kids and very close to Nantes train station. There’s a restaurant inside the gardens but you need to book as we found out. You can also visit a little brasserie just outside of the gardens next to the train

Nice, peaceful strolling in the Autumn look of this garden in the middle of the city. From the Chateau, go ten minutes walk. It was vibrant everywhere since it was a bank holiday. Sit and relax in a greenery, golden autumn sphere.
It's a small and cozy garden with many birds and animals, green sculpture of cat was absolutely fantastic.
somes years ago, Nantes Botanic Garden decided to get help from a kid book writer: Claude Ponty, and their collaboration to redesign this historical beautiful park made it wonderful.
Enjoy a relaxing stroll around this lovely city garden. Lots of areas to sit and chat and admire the view. If you have young children with you there is a great play area.

After a long walk we strolled through here enjoying the well landscaped spaces, the ducks, geese and goats and the very well labeled gardens. They featured an excellent area representing annuals. A wonderful play area for children. And romantic paths for strolling. What a gem in
Nice parc with birds and goats. Play ground. Nice cafe. Flowers. Nice size parc. Concerts sometimes there.

We stopped in at this garden while in Nantes..it is lovely. Several entrances, lots of quirky art, places to sit and visit, have a picnic, smile at the bird art in some of the trees and of course many different plants to look at. Hubby and I make a point of touring gardens

Easily accessible gardens in Nantes. Beautifully laid out with lots of points of interest, including topiary, waterfalls, sculptures and planted structures, and a grass shadow! Nantes city centre has a fabulous vibe with many pavement cafes and eateries and wonderful buildings

This place has so much to offer Every plant under the sun, wild life, petting goats, weird hens, tea rooms, good toilets, brilliant play area for children, lakes, hot houses, exotoc plants, handy to city for a short walk or long stop, unusual little things to look for like birds

We came to Nantes for Les Machines, but this huge public park and gardens turned out to be one of the best we have ever visited. Bring your camera as the vistas and the flowers are spectacular. Take your time and walk the entire park. There is a beautiful site at every turn.

The gardens are fairly centrally located, close to the railway station on one side and the Arts Museum on the other. The gardens are beautifully kept, there are benches everywhere so plenty of places to sit and reflect on life and the universe etc, and lots of birds, ponds,
Best park I've ever been to! Artwork was amazing, avium to see, plants and flowers were really beautiful

I love going in the garden during the day, just to wander around, climb on the huge chairs, take pictures of the wonderful gardens and especially feed the goats at the entrance (when you come from the train station). This garden is a peace of heaven in the city centre. If you

Just across from the central train station - but you soon forget that you are in a town altogether. The park is just big enough to accommodate a multitude of paths. There are ponds and fountains, too. If you don't only want to enjoy looking at the plants and trees, you can read

Gardens are beautiful and well laid out for all ages - children especially welcome. Interesting specialised areas - for me the bog garden with insectivorous plants was the top attraction but many other distinct plantings were very interesting. Every grass areas appeared to have
Well kept and beautifully presented gardens; this place has a restaurant and is lovely to wonder around.

This is really a awesome place to hang out on a sunny day. We visited this place when we followed the green line. We did have some drinks in the center of the park at the restaurant. They have a lot of different plants in the garden 🌸🌼

We visited the garden on Monday 28th August. I really want to see the sleeping bird in the picture but it has since gone. I has been replaced by a sleeping cat (althought it looks more like a bear). It's giant and really cute. The garden is really well kept with interesting

This place is awesome! Really great place to stroll around with the family and if you have little kids there is a ton of things for them to do to boot! There is a paddling pool the little ones can spend hours playing in as well as a really good kids play area and also an area

Wonderful park in the heart of Nantes, with some really quirky touches. Flower Palette - concentration of annuals with labels ......so colourful and useful! Wildlife abounds - We found frogs and terrapins, giant fish, dragonflies, and so many different types of ducks! along
Nice park with some unusual garden features and exhibits. Really lovely place to sit and relax in the sun after a few hours in the nearby Arts Museum.

We thought the Jardin des Plantes was pretty, though a bit too tidy. But what we loved most about it was that it is a perfect place to relax and have a drink after a visit to the Musée d'Arts. While the art museum cafe is very expensive and rather depressing, the Jardin terrace

At a walking distance from the Castle, this is one of the 100 parks that makes Nantes famous for its green areas . Very well maintained in all its parts, there is an area where kids (and adults) can caress goats and closely see hen of different types. Very nice stop!
Within easy walking distance from hotel. Visited twice. Full of art as well of lakes, fountains and trees and flowers. Restaurant, hot houses etc.
Located just in front of the railway station this garden is really nice and cured. Fresh in summer time, a wonderful spot of green in a nice town.
A wonderful place to relax and enjoy. You can take your children to play there. Nice fountans and lot of diferent flowers and plants.
Very impressed by the gardens. We visited on a Tuesday where there was free games for children. Lovely restaurant in the garden. Easily spend a couple of hours here
For an hours relaxing walk visit this park - its lovely. Very well maintained and lovely to just relax in.

OMG what a beautiful oasis in the middle of a busy city. Loads of green spaces, lots of stuff for kids to get involved with, paddling pools, petting zoo with the goats and chickens. Lots of interesting statues, fountains, lakes and plants. Masses to look at. Lovely little
Very impressive and well laid out with a big collection. Didn't have children with me but looked very child friendly.
This a wonderful park with many spaces to sit and relax. Take a picnic and enjoy the stunning scenery. Great for families of all ages.

We thought what can all the fuss be about when a garden is the top attraction of a city. It is, however, absolutely beautiful and intensely relaxing. The only complaint, Mr Kill-Joy on his bicycle who enforces the prohibition of sitting on any grass or children playing anywhere

This park has so much in it - goats that the children can pet, ducks, geese, hens, benches (I never saw so many benches in a park before, including some really unusual / funny ones), cafe, strange plants, a few playgrounds (including one made of giant flowerpots!), lots of
Beautifully maintained park and gardens-very popular with all ages .especially families with children
Jardin des Planted is a wonderful park with many springs and water areas, but many planes with low altitude are flying directly over the park, due to the nearby airport.
We spent a lovely hour exploring the park. Lots of little paths, benches, and places for kids to play. If you're in Nantes for more than half a day, then it's worth a visit.

This place is an oasis of beauty and calm right across the road from the central station. We visited on our last day before we went to the airport and it was a great way to come down from a hectic few days. There are some really attractive garden features and water features in
Lots to see in here. Fountains, sculpture, greenhouses, etc. Nice quiet interlude from the bustle of Nantes.

Beautifully maintained gardens. The bird bush wasn't there when we visited but was replaced by a sleeping bear instead. Lovely for a picnic but bare in mind that the grass is not for sitting on, instead there are plenty of benches dotted around. The feed-able goats were a

Great place to spend the afternoon when it's very hot! You can bring some food and stay there a while watching the nature around you! It can be noisy sometimes because there are some children playing around. Besides that it is a great place to breathe inside the city
I was enchanted by these beautiful gardens. I think I was lucky to see it in june. It's very peaceful and quiet, a perfect spot to relax.
Beautiful gardens, has a sense of fun. Fantastic food. Easy to find, and a real must for anyone just wanting a few hours peace and quiet. Great place for families.
Nice green park with many beautifuel spots, fantastic flowers and many small waterhuls with birds etc.
This is one of the best maintained parks I have seen any where. A wide range of trees and plants and also several small lakes. Could do with a small cafe for breakfasts.
Beautiful gardens, well worth the walk. Lots of lakes, paths take you around the gardens, good views around. Toilets and a nice cafe. Quiet and peaceful place.
Very interesting ! A professional gardener might spend two days there . Very well preserved place with breathtaking views .

We began at the Orangerie where you can grab a coffee in the morning or full lunch from 12. A fascinating variety of buildings, sculptures and plants surrounds you. Greenhouses hold exotic varieties and there are water gardens too. Great place for children to run around in as

This garden has a nice amount of plants from different places and it is very easy to visit, to walk and also, to enjoy. Interact with nature, birds, ducks, fish are there for you. Also a nice collection of flowers, perfect to visit during spring.
Rightly No.1 in Nantes Contains many interesting features: Jules Verne Statue Large Park Bench Benches a la Dali Also, and out if the usual - Don't walk on the grass! 1775

Well laid out gardens with some very interesting, imaginative displays. Just opposite the main railway station. Cafe on site but a good cafe outside the main entrance.Allow about an hour to wander around. Walk back into Nantes centre about 15 minutes, passing the chateau on the
Very nice garden, it s a near of the nantes station , different plants , good walk. If you come Nantes you must to visit the garden
Much smaller than we expected from viewing the map of Nantes, but a lovely quiet space with a very wide variety of trees, shrubs and plants.
The garden was really beautiful, and we enjoyed our visit. I recommend visiting the garden, especially in the spring/summer.
Beautiful gardens with lots of fun displays. The flowers were just amazing and the whole place was so well maintained

One of the most beautiful parks I've seen in France. There are lots of flower types and decorations, there are several little ponds with different birds, the trees had lots of flowers (rhododendron, camelia, cherry, etc) in early April. There are also lots of funny sculptures
Really lovely place. Great botanics and kitchen garden. Very peaceful. We visited in spring which was a great time for the flowering shrubs and bedding.

Within the environs of the city, Nantes boasts several parks and gardens, but the most written about is the Jardin des Plantes situated in the Bouffay Quarter. There are three main entrances, Bvd de Stalingrad near the SNCF station, the top of rue Stanislas Baudry and rue

We had a pleasant stroll around the park on a hot Sunday afternoon. It was very busy, children playing in the play areas and paddling pools, people sitting enjoying picnics etc, but it was still surprisingly peaceful.

We were sad to miss the Camelia displays which must be magnificent in early spring with a whole avenue of these showy flowers. Overall the garden was a lovely place to spend a few hours - easy walking with a easy to navigate layout. Lots of interesting plants and trees.

Nice walking around the many routes through the park. Water features, ducks, loads of plants from around the world, many different things to see. Lake and fountain, water falls and fun things. And it's free! Oh yeah and they had a little cafe.

Stunning figures and sometime to start the morning with a great walk. Next to our Hotel Sozo by the way excellent(a Chapel turnedhotel). Nantes a town not advertized with a lot to enjoy with the family. This park among the best I ve been to.

Jardin des Plantes is a wonderful park. Worth a visit for plants and flowers lovers. This garden has an amazing variety of plants. I travelled to Nantes for a few days stay in March 20176. Spent an hour walking around the gardens at Jardin des Plantes. Very well kept and pretty.

What a lovely place to walk around. In March the camellias are in full bloom & magnificent. Really interesting & then sit at restaurant & take time out with a coffee. Food looked very good. A definite placeto visit when in Nantes

Situated right outside of the North side of the train station in Nantes is the Jardin des Plantes. Given the hussle and bustle that happens around the train station with people hanging around and running to catch trams it's nice to have someplace that's just calm. There's a

The plaque outside the gate said open every day - but we only managed to find it open on the day we were at the station to leave (Wednesday). It looked lovely but we did't have time to look round properly.
I enjoyed the park, it is creative and a great place for the solo traveller to relax or the family to enterain the children

Established tree and shrubs all named. Area with herbs grouped for various ailments. Spring plants and bulbs beginning touch up through the soil. Seeds and plants from over the world. all area labelled. free entry into two of the glass houses, the others can been seen with a
Meandering paths, plants well labeled, children's' petting zoo in corner. Interesting sculpture which has lost two of its original figures is nearby.
Worth a visit for plants and flowers lovers. All sorts of trees in particular. Including rare species.
Nice garden with various adornment throughout the seasons and the events of the year. Quite big and not far from the center.

Have ben here a few times at different seasons, and always find it most interesting. As an avid gardener in zones 6-5, this garden has an amazing variety of plants in a similar range 5-7, most beautifully presented. Just walking around the garden is a delight.
Travelled to Nantes for a few days stay in August 2016. Spent an hour walking around the gardens at Jardin des Plantes. Very well kept and pretty. Free entrance too. Suitable for children to visit.
Had a lovely lunch in a restaurant near-by with friends then walked to the gardens. It was a beautiful Sunday afternoon at the end of April There was a free concert. The day was perfect,
This is one of the most beautiful city-centre parks I've visited. Very interesting, lots to see, great for dogs and kids. Would definitely recommend a visit :)

This is a great place to go whatever your age or the weather: the long line of flower pots meandering round the park initially growing plants then eyes and tongues; the benches of steadily increasing size with a correspondingly increasing sized tree beside it; and the different
Truly lovely to leave the busy streets and stroll around magnificent plants and beautiful trees all so stylishly done and planted, well worth the visit. Peaceful and interesting...
Great park with a lot of 'green art' year round! Go experience it yourself. The park has everything you search for in a park, including Victorian greenhouses and even a lovely tearoom!
Nice place close to the center to visit. There is also great cafe to eat lunch in the middle of carden.
Beautiful trees, shrubs, ponds with fabulous ducks and other birds, enhanced by the work of an artist. What fun!
A great place to visit after a wander around the city to take some rest and relax. Take a picnic, restaurants can be a bit expensive.
A beautiful haven located close to the centre of the city. Would definitely recommend if you are in Nantes for a number of days.

Be sure to visit this free garden if you are in or near Nantes. A thirty minute to one hour walk through the gardens provides a much needed respite from the stress and strain of travel or just a peaceful haven from city hustle and bustle. The plant sculptures and metal
Jardin des Plantes is such a beautiful place to visit. A place for you take a scenic leisurely walk or to sit and enjoy the surroundings. Definitely a place to visit when you are in Nantes.
Every city needs a park like this. Fun, relaxing and close to the city centre. Worth a visit when you're in Nantes.

Visited with family, had coffee on the terrace. After the initial complete tour of this gem, came back several times just for a quick sit down and think. Clean, safe, close to the train station, a little haven from the city life.

A lovely park with plenty of nice places to sit and have a picnic, then feed the ducks with the leftovers. Some odd quirky plant and bench 'sculptures, which amused us. Lovely old glasshouses, but despite getting a ticket from reception, couldn't manage to work out the access

Beautiful gardens with vegetal and wooden works by the artist Claude Ponti, a greenhouse, a pond with birds, a little waterfall, many benches by the trees, a playground for young children, a café... a haven of peace in the frenzy of the city!

Lovely gardens for a stroll and to take a break from the city. We always come here to have some coffee and watch the world go by. The playground for the kids is great and it is near the entrance to the park. We like that all the trees and plants are labeled. Interesting

Jardin des Plantes is a lovely park for strolling and relaxing and totally free to enjoy. Situated close to the Nantes Gare, it was a surprise to find such a lovely, whimsical, and shady place to relax. Plenty of benches to sit down after a full day of walking the city.

Me, hubby and 11 month old visited the Jardin design Plantes whilst in Nantes. They are beautiful and well worth the visit. On reflection we didn't allow enough time to see everything which was disappointing. Highly recommend, very clean and free! They are located a short

This park is across the road from the TGV station so it's a very easy first stop or last relaxing coffee prior to leaving. It's dotted with sculptures and full of ducks and other birds as well as some stunning 19th century observatory buildings that are amazing There is a nice

We loved this garden, and went twice ... the second time to just sit on a bench and enjoy the surroundings. Lots of families out enjoying themselves. Very different from the Jardin des Plantes in Paris, and really much nicer.

We went round the gardens on a sunny Sunday afternoon and there were a lot of people there both young and old. The gardens are truly beautiful with lots of borders and islands of flowers, thickly packed with a multitude of brightly coloured flowers. The flowers and lawns were in

I didn't know I would be walking through a park, it's lovely the flowers are beautiful. There are creative little designs. Unfortunately the cafe wasn't doing food. We got something near by & had a picnic.

I wasn't too keen about going here as it was a really hot day but my wife really wanted to go. Thankfully there were plenty of shaded areas to get a break from the sun. Obviously the plants were good but it is the displays with typical French humour that set this garden apart

We went there after hearing from locals what a great place it is to go and it is, there are some farm animals which the children can get in with pet and feed; As well as so many wonderful walk ways around or through the park. A really good pond near the front with a fountain
There are so many cute touches to this garden. Staff have done a superb job of layout and design. Must be seen to be believed.

It's a really nice place to take a walk and see a beautiful garden. You can see everything was built with a lot of love for plants,flowers and even animals. You also can enjoy feeding farm animals. A great thing to do with young children. It was a hot day when we visited Nantes

We went here for a little shade during the heatwave and were very surprised what a lovely park it was. It had a huge number of benches to sit on. It wasn't a formal botanical garden, and all the better for that. It was attractively laid out, with lots of quirky offerings.
Picturesque gardens with great play area for young kids. Has sand and water play equipment which my little one loved. There was a nice little cafe also to grab a coffee by the play area too.

Beautiful gardens for a stroll all well kept and no litter. There is free entry and a lovely cafe to sit and take in your surroundings. Beautiful sculptures made out of pots and plants make it really interesting. Definatley worth a visit.

Fantastic and original garden in the city center. Peaceful, surprising and even surrealistic. Children will enjoy feeding the sweet goats at a corner. Apart from wander around and discover the surprises (really nice with little children), I recommend the "Plage vert" area or
Despite the large number of people here, we just loved the gardens. They are absolutely beautiful and we also really enjoyed overlooking the playground from the terrace.

This is a wonderful garden set close to the city centre and so easily reached on foot. Good for those with an eye for plants as well those who just want to walk and appreciate greenery within the city. There is also a very cafe just to sit and enjoy some drinks.
Absolutely lovely surroundings .. very well kept right in the centre of nantes.. You can park out side if your early and it's a short walk to various other sights from there
Fun for kids and adults. Great place to relax. Love the whimsical topiary. Not a huge place so plan for 1-2 hours at most.

Brilliant park for some R&R amongst the hectic pace of the city. Beautiful plants arranged in interesting displays, a little petting zoo, tropical greenhouses to explore, a great children's play area and paddling pool and a nice little tea shop/cafe.
Very funny garden with interesting installations. Very good place to rest and think. This is also a good place if you like to watch the birds.

Nice to walk around to chill out from the hustle and bustle of the town. Well stocked and well kept gardens/park. We followed sat nav to get there as the road signs are very hit and miss with nothing until you are almost there. Lots of parking available on the road around the
Puts UK municipal gardens to shame, big time. Superbly kept collection, interesting walks, places to eat and sit. Everything tidy, varied, cared for. Yet another reason to visit Nantes.

Play areas, fountains, cafe. Benches everywhere. Lots of lovely little paths to explore and plenty of places for a picnic. So many ducks my boy was beside himself. The massive fish and Terrapins were a bonus. Well worth a visit

Wasn't planning on visiting but went in as it was a lovely sunny day. Great for a wander around. Interesting botanical sculptures (didn't think pots of kale could look so good!), beautiful trees and quite a variety too. Look out for the carnivorous plants in the green house. The

I don't normally visit botanical gardens when traveling, but this was relatively close to the hotel, so why not. And I was in for a surprise. Wonderfully laid out, quite large considering it is close to the town center and near a railway station. Lots of outdoor activity for
A really nice day to spend a hot afternoon. Wandered around a lovely sculptures park. Nice ponds with plant sculptures and greenhouses and other plant exhibitions.

This botanical garden is a bit more than "just" a botanical garden. I mean don't get me wrong, there's all the stuff that a botanical garden should have, including a lot of information about the plants and so forth. But these guys have taken the context a bit further - with cool
Close to the centre this park is great fun and well maintained. This year a trail of vegetables in pots led you across and around the various areas.

The gardens are a must see in Nantes. They are very accessible and offer a wide range of trees and garden beds in a very historic setting. There are interesting 19th century green houses and whimsical art installations (summer 2016) and other permanent features. Of special

We came along to the park on our way out of Nantes and stayed much longer than intended. The weather was lovely and the plant life really nice. A good touch for the children was the menagerie where goats and other animals could be petted.

Fine garden with lots of variety, works of art, play areas for children and benches for tired tourists and visitors. A stone's throw from the soon to be reopened museum of arts, and a five minutes' walk from the Castle.

After following the green line all around Nantes, I finally ended up here and what a peaceful place to be surrounded by the beauty of nature. It is so nice and such a surprise. I rested here for ages as my feet were weary from walking.

This is not just another small nicely trimmed public park. This small park has many small strange features that make this park exceptional. There are laughing mushrooms, goats you can pet, benches in different sizes and shapes and plants groomed to shape.
This is a lovely English style garden (imitative of nature, rather than geometrical) obviously well-used by the residents of Nantes.

Enjoyed this peaceful garden with lots of unique features, especially enjoyed the ice cream plant pot feature and the growing features on the plant pots although a little disappointed that it didn't seem to have an end! Recommend for a place to take children, a peaceful stroll
... by connecting with nature in this marvelous all colors creative, educational and inspiring setting

This lovely park is just across the road from the train station. A tranquil place to walk or pass some time sitting and listening to the birds. There are some small ponds, interesting sculptures, children's play areas and even a petting zoo with some friendly goats. The garden

Wow...what a wonderful mix of flora and fauna. From the beautifully manicured gardens to the goats, ducks and chickens that frequent the park, you will not be disappointed in this lush mix of plants and water features. I enjoyed going for a morning run along the gravel path
Imagination and design, color and texture, what a beautiful peaceful place, bring a camera bring a lover and stroll

The jardin is modelled on the 'English' style of formal garden. It is a delight and is very well cared-for. There are toilets at either end, many places to sit and a cafe. While we were there it was full of garden-inspired art installations. We spent hours, but even a quick

Our group of four (4 years, 8 years, 18 years and 43 years) all loved it. Or course nicer in good weather. The goats were a lot of fun, to get into the same space with them. One of them tried eating the skirt of my daughter which gave us good laughs. You should visit while in
Great park with a free entry. Very relaxing and interesting. Lots of amazing plants and birds but also goats you can feed and chickens.

These gardens are located just across from the train station and are free to enter. Wonderfully manicured, with shrubs and trees sculpted into various creatures. Lovely water features. You can exit from the other entrance and almost immediately be at the Château des ducs de
This pleasant park is very close to the train station and it has some amazing plants, topiary, and art installations. Well worth a detour or even a planned outing.
Nice gardens to spend an hour or two in, pets area for children but be aware that you are not allowed on the grass in the gardens so it may be a bit of a struggle letting the children loose
Nice place to walk around. Well maintained. I did see more interesting botanical gardens but this one is not that bad too. Nice stay.
Wow, beautiful garden. It is really made for people. There is a small goat petting zoo, all sorts of fun sculptures, amazing plantes, benches of ALL sizes. A must! It is next to the station.
such a lovely Park, I could have spent all afternoon there. So many different types of trees, something different around each corner. Great for people watching.

I like this place very much. There is something new every year like a big bird sculpted in a bush or a gigantic bench or a sleeping cat sculpted in a bush. it's very relaxing garden across the street from the train station and a few minutes walk from the city center,
A lovely park in the heart of Nantes. A must visit and relaxing place. I live nearby the park. The park has so many things to offer for children, adults and old people.

A beautiful oasis of botany, peace and art in a busy city. They may not encourage you to walk on the grass but there's lots you look at, from the well labeled plants to the art installations. For the children the goats are enchanting and fun to feed and the play area lets them
amazing place filled with nature and peace everyone should at least take a quick tour or a long nap in the park

Our hotel was across from the jardin, so we walked through it to get to the old town. We also sat and enjoyed the peace. It's a beautifully-kept garden with some surprises: goats and chickens (weird chickens). The best time to see the baby goats is in the evening, when
Gorgeous gardens , as gardeners we were very impressed with the planting, a mix of casual and formal. We sat for a morning drinking it in and people watching . And it's free!,

We were delighted to discover the Jardin des Plantes. We had been walking for ages, so found it a delightful place to sit down and relax. My husband (expert gardner) was thrilled with the plants. There was a children's playground and a temporary stage for a concert that was to

Relaxing walk in an amazing scenery, and every few minutes you can see planes passing over the garden. I wanted to see the sculptures but sadly they were not put up yet. The giant bench is nice. And it is definetely something to visit when you are in Nantes

Its free, open to the public, very central with easy (motorbike) parking and an on site café. Very well laid out and clearly loved by the locals, there's a wealth of flora and fauna across the several acres of gardens and walkways. Many plants are labelled so you know what

This is a small jardin des plantes but it is so precious. It has some tailored japanese theme gardens and it has man made created plan illusions. The flowers through out are so pretty and it has a great cafe with a reasonable price menu as well as delicious

Nantes Jardin de Plantis is another way in which this city with a blend of old & new has further diversified. The gardens are a calming, beautifull place & were well patronised by young, old, couples & kids when we visited, entry was free.

A beautiful sunny morning with many families taking advantage of the weather. Paths meandered through the gardens past reflective ponds,fountains and flower beds bursting with the colours of Spring. Generally you are not allowed to walk on the grass, but there is a playground

This is not a huge botanic garden and it is near the tram stop at the Central Station. It is beautifully designed with several little ponds and some nice views of them with the very well kept vegetation. Lots of benches in nice locations and a café with a terrace with a nice
I often walk here with my dog. It's a great place to enjoy the sunshine, and the works of art for the Voyage de Nantes are always amusing.
We had a fun half hour there with the kids, feeding the goats and walking around. really nice way to take a break for free right in the city centre.

Without a doubt the highlight of our trip to Nantes, from the petting zoo with goats and chickens, the amazing plant life, the lakes, the birds, the public art, the playground and the cafe/bar/restaurant beside it you could spend hours in the wonderful park.
We enjoyed a nice stroll in the small, but beautiful park. Lots of information about trees and flowers, and very nicely landscaped garden. A good and free experience in Nantes

These beautiful gardens are close by the Gare. They were looking at there best this spring morning, full of flowers, a wonderful variety of trees and shrubs from around the world, and a few quirky sculptures thrown in! The gardens are on the green line walking route around
Green garden in Nante. Take some time to walk and relax on this excellent and well treated garden. Discover every little space :) you will not be disappointed.
Just something to do when you want to relax, enjoy a bit of green and flowers and have a short break in between castels and cathedrals.
We spent a couple of hours in the park. Tulips of all colours were blooming, the camelias must look great a little earlier in the year. We had lunch in the Orangerie. Great terrace on a sunny day!!!
came here on the way to a visit to a friend in nantes , arrived by train and could visit it till she came to pick me up and it was a nice garden to go through thats really nicely build

This is a lovely space to wander and see the different trees and plants. It was a smaller space than expected and many buildings were either under construction or closed for the season. It was interesting to watch the 'active' birds in the park. You cannot walk on the grass. The

A real fun garden. Actually more like a park. Very well kept grounds and litter free. Well landscaped with lots of ponds for the many varieties of ducks. Main feature in gardens was a giant sleeping cat made from earth with a grass coat. Loads of benches and some all different
Relaxing. Really good to get in touch with nature, to take a walk around. Depending on the day, it's possible to find the park almost empty to walk in total peace
Place that you must see. Lovely animals, lots of small birds ans ducks...plants from all the world. Excellent place for walk and chilling.

We spent several hours here looking around and enjoying the sunshine. Beautiful flowers, birds and trees everywhere with querky benches and toilet facilities. Dogs can go in on a lead. Its very clean and well maintained. A must see in Nantes I think!

The botanical garden is really well maintained and people love to visit it. The variation of plants and the way they are taking care of make this place a little heaven in a sunny day. There are playgrounds for kids also and a beautiful pond where you can admire various types of
Wonderful to just stroll around and relax in. Easy to find and with little delights such as quirky benches, a Japanese aviary and sculptures dotted around.

A beautiful place where you can relax and enjoy nature inside a city. It's also a great opportunity to learn for those studying or who have an interest in plants because there are a lot of unique types of plantes there.

Relaxing and lush garden/park, not far from the rail station, with whimsical giant animal topiaries and sculpture. Recommended for pleasant stroll or "pique-nique".

The Jardin des Plantes is a lovely place to wander. Each section is well appointed, very well maintained and interesting to look at. Highlights included the giant bench and the trolls!

Very pretty, loved all the various different parts of the gardens. The goats and chickens give something for all ages.
Quirky and lovely botanic garden which has features to appeal to all ages including children - definitely worth a visit.

This park is free and well worth an hour to stroll around. Lovely displays containing humour and delight around every corner. I especially loved the laughing garden and Alice in Wonderland type shrinking benches. Magnificent.

This is a nice park with some fun elements. We loved the big to small benches and other sculptures. The playground is for young children.

Highly interesting. There are 30 rooms to visit. A lot of interactive screens for children. Guided tours and a very "Breton" restaurant.

Wonderful collection of trees all named and plenty of seats for weary travellers. Close to station so a good place to wait for the train Toilets not good

this was SO great, its amazing and in the city center... its THE place to take the kids for an afternoon play and they have a nice coffe shop at the west side
We just stumbled onto these gardens, and it was a delightful surprise. A great place to relax and snap some wonderful pictures.
A relaxing place to chill picnic or just stroll. I also got lots of great pictures of the eye catching flowers.

Just gorgeous and peaceful. Took a walk through the meandering footpaths after a lovely breakfast. The springs run among the plants, the old trees, and grassy areas. Sit on one of the benches and take it all in. Try mid morning when things are quiet.

Lovely free place to visit. There are toilets, cafes, benches and plenty of grass space to sit and have your own picnic. text.wiki:
Nantes Cathedral, or the Cathedral of St. Peter and St. Paul of Nantes (French: Cathédrale Saint-Pierre-et-Saint-Paul de Nantes), is a Roman Catholic church located in Nantes, Pays de la Loire, France. The cathedral is in the Gothic architectural tradition. Construction of the church began in 1434, on the site of a Romanesque cathedral, and took 457 years to finish, finally reaching completion in 1891. It has been listed since 1862 as a monument historique by the French Ministry of Culture.


== Background ==
The reconstruction of the cathedral commenced during the early to mid-15th century during a time when Nantes and Brittany were commercially prosperous, initiating such large-scale architectural projects on a wide scale, partly owing to the opportunist and skilful diplomatic policy of John V in a period of political turmoil and conflict with England.


== History ==
The cathedral's foundation stone was laid on 14 April 1434, by John V, Duke of Brittany and Jean de Malestroit, Bishop of Nantes (1417–1443). The first architect in charge was Guillaume de Dammartin who was later replaced by Mathurin Rodier. The construction began with the west façade, the aisles of the nave and its lateral chapels.Leniaud et al. divide the building process in five phases. The first phase took place between c. 1434 and c. 1470. In this period the west façade and the tower bay were built, as were the south aisle of the nave with its chapels, and the south arcade pillars. The bases of those pillars resemble the ones of the choir of Mont-Saint-Michel, which was begun after 1444. The arms of Duke John, who died in 1442, were placed in the staircase to the balcony, above the ducal portal, on the south side of the southern tower bay. The vaults in the belfry of that tower were decorated with the arms of Bishop Guillaume de Malestroit (1443–1462). The triforium of the tower bay was constructed in an earlier and different style (Late Gothic Flamboyant, with a network of reticulated tracery) than the one of the nave proper. Bronze decoration of the central portal's doors was undertaken in 1482.
The second phase took place from c. 1470 to c. 1490. During this time the nave, the north aisle and its chapels were built. They were completed by 1485 or slightly later. The west wall of the north transept and the north-west crossing pier, perhaps up to capital height, were also constructed in this period.

In the third phase, c.1500–1516, the glass in the great west window was installed (1498), as a gift from Queen Anne. In 1500 took place the vaulting of the first bay of the nave. From 1508 to 1516 the eastern bay of the south aisle of the nave and its chapel was completed and vaulted; the south transept was begun, finishing most of the upper parts of its western wall by 1519–1520. The financial support came from Bishop Guillaume Guegen and the architect was Jacques Drouet.
The last phase is the post-medieval one. It spanned from c.1626 to 1630 and led to the completion of the nave high vaulting (four eastern bays) and the construction of the nave flyers. The south transept was completed sometime between 1631 and 1637 or perhaps later, in a sympathetic Gothic style. Louis Le Vau recommended to the Chapter at Nantes, in about 1650, to build the choir in a Gothic style.
The rest of the north transept and the choir, under the direction of St. Felix Seheult (city architect), were finished between 1840 and 1891, at a time of keen revival of the Catholic faith. The long wait was also due to the fact that the former Romanesque church was standing right next to the city's protective walls, which had to be taken down before completing the choir, while destroying the remains of the previous cathedral as it was covered by the larger, new one.
The edifice was damaged by Allied bombing during World War II, on 15 June 1944. On 28 January 1972, a gigantic fire started on the roof. Firemen managed to bring it under control, but the timber frame was severely damaged and many other damages were inflicted. This event led to what was undoubtedly the most complete interior restoration of a cathedral in France.
The elevation and the regularity of the plan of the cathedral are French. Still the majority of the details are Late Gothic, e.g., the absence of capitals, the plinths with concave sides and separated bases for the shafts, the Flamboyant tracery, and the masking of the piers by shafts.


== Architecture ==


=== Dimensions ===
Height of the towers – 63 m (192 ft)
Height of the roof – 49 m (149 ft)
Height of nave – 37.5 m (114 ft)
Interior width – 38.5 m (117 ft)
Interior length – 103 m (335 ft)
Length of the chancel – 30 m (91 ft)


=== Exterior ===
The facade of the Cathedral of Nantes is dominated by two large towers, stretching up above the top terrace. It presents several remarkable characteristics, e.g., (1) the presence of an external pulpit, designed to preach to the crowd assembled on the square, and (2) the presence of five richly decorated gates, three of them on the façade and two to the sides (see Ground plan, positions 1 - Main Gate, 2 - Gate of St. Paul, 3 - Gate of St. Yves, 32 - Gate of St. Donatien and St. Rogatien and 33 - Gate of St. Peter).


=== Interior ===
The plain façade is largely compensated for by the polish of the interior of the building. The whiteness of the stone, accentuated by recent restoration work, the imposing dimensions of the nave and the aisles and the effect of the immense inner column create a Gothic atmosphere inside the cathedral.
Inside the cathedral are the tomb of Francis II, Duke of Brittany (position 10) and of his wife Marguerite de Foix, the (parents of Anne of Brittany), made at the beginning of the 16th century by Michel Colombe and Jean Perréal. The cathedral also houses the cenotaph of General de Lamoricière (position 23), a monument set up in 1878 in papal homage to him.


== Other information ==
In front of the cathedral, on 5 September 1661, on the order of Louis XIV, Nicolas Fouquet was arrested by d'Artagnan.


== Gallery ==

		
		
		
		
		


== References ==


== Further reading ==
Cocke, T. H., (1990) Gothique Moderne: The Use of Gothic in Seventeenth Century France, In P. Crossley and E. Fernie, Medieval Architecture and its Intellectual Context. Studies in Honour of Peter Kidson. London and Ronceverte, 1990, 249-257.

text.quote: Catholic cathedral built between 1434 & the late 19th century, with sculpted tombs & stained glass.
trip: This is a such a huge church. A monstrous size building with many altars and stained glass windows. I do think how this kind of structure was built without proper equipment but with such a precision and finesse with every small detail. It is a free to visit it so don’t skip it!
The church was beautiful and we'll kept. If you're passing by and have 15-30 minutes to spare go inside!

Our group of travellers from Canada visited this most amazing cathedral while touring Nantes. The cathedral of course is beautiful! It is 102 meters long and the ceilings are 29 meters high. The construction began in 1434 on the site of a Romanesque cathedral and took 457 years
Beautiful and serene cathedral. Definitely worth a walk through. Had to imagine about many 100s of years it took to build. Several unique tombs with amazing monuments carved from marble.
The cathedral is beautifully light & airy, with modern glass. The royal tomb is a spectacular piece of Renaissance stonework.

At a walking distance from the "Chateau des Ducs", this cathedral has one of the highest ceiling I ever saw. Simple decoration, very beautifully shaped columns. It has the highest stained glass window in France. Really majestic.

This cathedral is stunning. There are many different kinds of stained glass windows. There are many medieval paintings and statues dedicated to various saints and Jesus and the virgin Mary. The whole ambiance is amazing. There is a lot to see inside and many intricate details.

This is quite simply a stunning building, let alone its religious significant. Inside the cathedral is a very moving place and there is no one rushing you along. You take the time you want to view the cathedral and give what prayers you may choose to make. One feature, unlike
The cathedral was amazing! Such magnificent architecture. We enjoyed exploring inside. Absolutely beautiful.

This cathedral is not as ornate as some others in France with the stained glass windows being quite modern compared to some. It was also very clean outside and you can see the white stone to great effect. Lovely space to wander around with a small donation if you wish.
This cathedral is a master piece for nantes. Viewed from a far and it stands out as an amazing monument. You will see thus quite far and say what this is. Go and view!! Must!
Would love to have seen the crypt inside. Information indicated ypu cpuld see them . Typical french church not over the top
Nicely maintained cathedral however some areas were closed for renovation works. All the information inside was in French which is something to take note of.

After a serious fire in 1972 this gothic gem has been repaired and refurbished to better reflect the craftsmanship that went into building it to begin with. One can hope Notre Dame in Paris receives the same TLC to renovate it back to its original beauty.
A must see Cathedral both inside and out. Go round the back for access to the crypt. Well worth a few hours of your trip.

A huge gothic cathedral with two towers and three richly ornamented entrances, especially the central one. The interior with its three long naves is stunningly high and white, there are some tombs of the dukes and duchesses of Brittany to admire.

Wauw if you are in Nantes you should go see it. It is enormous from the outside. When you are inside there is so much to look at and all what you are seeing is very beautiful. I can’t understand how they build these buikding in the past. Magnifiek!!!!!!
It's a grand and spectacular cathedral. The stained glass and the tomb of Francoise II and Marguerite de Foix is pretty grand too.
Wow, just wow...you must visit this cathedral if you are in Nantes. Simply stunning, beautiful high ceilings and a crypt.
the nave is narrow and extremley tall very impressine. modern style stained glass windows. easy level access
The lofty nave of this gem will send you soaring. Absolutely magnificent! Full of history and architectural glory
Of course, France has many wonderful cathedrals, but don't miss this one in Nantes. It is fascinating and there are guides in English.
A very big and nice cathedral. Cool on a warm day. Its a bit imposing but still very nice. Nice decor inside
I do love a Cathedrale, and this one, with a mix of some modern stained glass elements and older side chapels is the perfectly cool antidote to a hot and bustling city.

This is an historic cathedral right in the center of Nantes. Admission is free. Vitrages are great and beautiful

As most of the cathedrals in France, this one is no exception. Impressive from outside and inside. Stained glass, the tomb of Francis II, Duke of Brittany. Have a look at the statues of the 12 Apostles on the sarcophagus... there exists a painting of the Cathedral by Auguste

This cathedral located in central Nantes is beautiful, well-maintained and tourist-friendly. Entering, one gets a sense of the scale of the building looking up 30+ meters into the arched ceiling. This should be on your list of things to do in Nantes.
A huge building on top of the hill behind the chateau. We didn't go in but marvelled on its size from outside

Beautiful stained glass windows, nave, spires, wooden doors, etc. The most fascinating artifact is the tomb of Francis the second and his queen. Intricate detail, symbolism, etc. including the apostles, mourners in black, the 4 corners of prudence, moral strength or courage,
A truly lovely Cathedral, in Nantes. So much architecture and atmosphere, well worth a visit if your in the area. Recommended
A very impressive cathedral. Worth going inside and see the beautiful and high ceiling. There are many beautiful sculptures and paintings inside.

I loved this cathedral. It’s bright and luminous probably due to extensive repair and clean up after a fire. Not dark and gloomy like so many are. Very high ceelings. It contains lovely work or art, unusual pieces. The stain glass is a bit disappointing as the original would

Majestic nave rising to 37.5meters - truly awesome, full of light from the white stone. According to the history, the first stones were laid in 1434 and the building only completed in 1891. Do view the tomb of Francois 11 and Marguerite de Foix from the metal stair viewpoint

The cathedral isn't as stunning as many others in Europe but it is worth visiting. The architecture is impressive and the whiteness of the interior is dazzling. The cathedral was extensively restored after allied bombing in 1944 and a fire in 1972, which makes the interior a
Located near the Chateau des Ducs de Bretagne, this beautiful Roman Catholic cathedral is a must to see. Exterior, in particular, is beautiful.
The cathedral is pretty big and very nice on the outside. Inside, it’s so so. Not as impressive as other big city cathedrals. In fact, apart from beautiful statues, it’s rather bland.

I visited Nantes once some years ago while on a business trip. This time I made the trip with my wife and we loved it. Still an awesome place to visit and learn a little about the history of this area. Beautifully maintained and well worth the time.

This is a beautifully preserved cathedral with is clean white stone and impressive vertical columns. The tombs tell the story of Anne who became duchess at the age of 10 and was promptly married off to other nobility. Worth a visit.
This is a huge cathedral with seating for more than 1000; The building is very picturesque and in a great location.

If you've studied European history, you won't want to miss seeing where the parents of Anne de Bretagne are buried. The stonework is beautiful. The cathedral is within walking distance of the chateau in the center of a popular pedestrian area with many cafes, bakeries, shops,
A fine building whose key attraction is the tomb of the Duke of Brittany and his wife. It is definitely worth visiting. A well restored church witha useful guide in English for 50 cents.

The cathedral is a very quiet and beautiful building, once inside I was surprised at how large the inside space was, it seemed huge. The architecture was outstanding. This is a lovely place to visit if you are interested in architecture or religion.
Yes a Cathedral and no surprises but the scale of it and the stain glass windows were awesome. Great architecture

Firstly, the gothic cathedral is beautiful and imposing. Construction started during the 1400s and finished during the 1800s. It was bombed during the Second World War so you'll notice that the stained glasses are new. Also pay attention to the two-tone columns and walls,
Lovely cathedral to visit, there is a guided tour which is free, so if you speak at bit of french its worth it as you are told little stories as you go round.
We attended mass here with the kids while on a short visit to Nantes. It is a beautiful cathedral and very serene.

It was very quiet & cool on a boiling hot day, which made visiting more enjoyable. There is so much to see. Also make sure to walk around the outside of the cathedral to the crypt, to really appreciate the architecture and history.
Mighty cathedral and wonderful to be there just before a wedding when the bells rang out over the city. Such a sound! Great explanations of everything in the Cathedral. Worth a visit.
Was under renovation when we were there but still opened for visitation. Impressive building, worth a visit. I believe it will be fantastic once finished.

When you step into this church, you will be stunned how clean the stone is. That is because it has been heavily restored, after war damage, and a catastrophic fire in the 70s. However, it is still well worth visiting. It has elegant lines, and the sculpture of Francois II's tomb
We had a short visit for such a beautiful Cathedral. Highly recommend a visit to this Gothic jewel. The quality of the stone sculptures is jaw dropping.

As far as cathedrals go very pretty. Nice link with the former city walls. Nice examples of stained glass windows. Very clean with a modern feel indoors.

Spent an hour reading about the cathedrals history and restoration whilst wandering round admiring the stained glass windows and statues. Wouldn’t say it was awesome, though peaceful and reflective time
Another must see. Cathedral of stunning proportions in a commanding position. Houses the tomb of Francois II de Bretagne and Marguerite de Foix. Definitely worth the pilgrimage.
This is such a beautiful place to visit; beauty, splendour, peace and calm. The architecture is awe-inspiring. The stained glass windows are particularly beautiful. Well worth a visit.

This is a cathedral of light. It has a wonderfully light feel to it in terms of illumination and general uncluttered ambiance. The coloured glass alone makes it worth a visit. It has had a tor ride recent history and a must see if you are in Nantes whether you are a believer or
This is a very tall cathedral and very well lit. It was a lovely place to visit and spend time. An important part of Breton history.

The exterior is imposing and the interior quite majestic with a very high vaulted roof. It is very light and airy. A notable feature is the tomb of the parents of Duchesse Anne, the last Duchess of Brittany.
An impressive Gothic building. The vaulted ceiling is very detailed as are some of the chapels within the Cathederal.It is probably one of the best Cathederals in France & is worth a visit.

We are a young at heart, retired couple, late fifties/early sixties, travelling down to Portugal on a 'road trip'. Our first night's stop after the overnight ferry to St Malo was Nantes and we couldn't resist this beautiful cathedral. Absolutely poles apart in our faith, I

reading the history of this Cathedral it has obviously got a lot of tales to tell, and given the bombings, fires etc it has been restored to a great standard with lots of attention to detail and careful blending of the old and the new - well worth a visit

There was a wedding there the day we came, the front courtyard area is nice and just around the city from the river and restaurants so easy to get around so made a pleasant little excursion from the hustle and bustle. Look out for the medieval remnants to the western wall.

Built in gothic architectural design which began construction in 1434. It took 457 years to complete. The highest tower is 63m and inside width is 38.5 m with an interior lenght of 103m. Inside you can also see the tomb of Francis II Duke of Brittany and his wife Marguerite de
If your a lover of Churches then not to be missed. Can combine with a visit to the Castle as almost next door. Lots of Churches to visit in Nantes.

Beatiful cathedral with nice vitrals. The cathedral was on fire on the 1970s. It can be notice on the cathedral walls

Monte Matre and Sacre Couer are pretty great but i didn’t get the same sense of still majesty as here because it’s smaller it feels more grounded in its religious life : history the hymns hopes & tears of centuries of worshippers are palpable : theres 9-11chapels all very
Impozant architecture, building. I recommend, becouse vibe there is so special. One of the best place in Nantes
Amazing architecture standout in a city, great experience to participate in Sunday event. Around there I can enjoy local cousins and shops!

Grand and impressive facade in the middle of the city center. Some France Cathedral i visited are sometimes interiorly dark. Yet upon entering this House of God, there is Lightness along with its colorful stained glasses windows. So fine feeling. There was a Latin Holy Mass when
The ceiling is supposedly higher than Notre Dame Paris, it is very imposing and beautifully illuminated at night.

This is a spectacular feast for the eyes. Inside of the cathedral is lovely. It is not as overdone and many cathedrals are and the interior is light and it makes it easy to see every detail. Many old cathedrals are dark inside but this is bright and welcoming.

We made time to see this cathedral when visiting Nantes. It was worth every minute. We walked there after seeing the Botanical Gardens, the Chateau due de Bretagne and St Clement. The outside is very well maintained, as is the inside, which is, as many are, undergoing
This is a Gothic church which has the tomb of Francois II. do not miss out this place. It is simply beautiful

Beautiful arhitectural pearl of Nantes. Especially worth visiting inside. Go to see a tomb on your right.
Some lovely stained glass windows, quite a simple cathedral but obviously well used by local staff. Carving on outside of building very interesting.
Such a beautiful cathedral in middle of Nantes. such a clamming quite peaceful place in the middle of a busy city, Well worth a visit

The Cathedrale is well worth visiting and, because it was rebuilt twice in the mid-late 20th century, it is in much better built condition than many French cathedrals. Of special visual note is the splendid stained glass windows and the high quality of stone carving.
Really useful visit. Very beautiful inside. Visit castle first and then go to cathedral to follow the story

We thought the cathedral was a bit of a let-down, but perhaps that is because we are so used to lush Italian churches. The only thing we found stunningly beautiful and interesting was the tomb of duke Francis II and his wife.
Its a typical cathedral and thankfully little of the idolatry that so many have. Is obviously very restful and interesting. Worth looking at but nothing remarkable.
In line with the style of the famous French cathedrals. It's the most beautiful in town, in my opinion. It deserves a visit.
Huge cathedral with a wonderful history. Incredibly ornate interior. Well worth a visit whether you are Christian or not
From all different angles, this is a towering cathedral slightly up the hill from the chateau. We were not able to get in but walked around the perimeter. Well lit at night.
Big Catholic cathedral reaching high up to the heavens. Pretty standard fayre in France but still worth a look. Its minimalism helps show off the amazingly simple stone work. Free entry.

The Gothic cathedral is most central and just a few minutes walk from the Chateau des Ducs de Bretagne. This Gothic style cathedral is most impressive both inside and out and most definitely worth a visit to marvel at it`s architecture. The Cathedral build was started in 1434

The beautiful cathedral is very bright inside, which differentiates her from others. It's also great to take photo from the outside and leaded glass.
This cathedral has been redone on the last 70 years twice. Once after WW II due to bombing & Gain after a fire on 1972. Deep history exists in this lovely cathedral.
While there are more beautiful cathedrals in France, you can certainly stop by here for a quick visit, particularly if you are already in Nantes. Very quiet and peaceful.
No entry fee. Very quiet &peaceful. Didn't stay long. But very pleasant anyway. Interesting house & garden round the side.
Even if it is just to walk round, its is impressive inside and a quiet sanctuary from the bustling streets
A beautiful cathedral which greatly impresses. The architecture is superb but then again there are dozens of churches like this all over France. Definitely worth a visit when in Nantes.
Worth 15 mins of anyone's time. Free too! Restored and missing some character of older gothic cathedrals in France.
its a city that offers you a visit to enjoy, during one afternoon The restaurants and shops are everywhere, the chatedral is amazing
Beautiful big cathedral with nice architecture. Not very crowded . The good thing is that there is no souvenir shop
There are lots of great cathedrals in Europe so I can't give it five stars but it is a very beautiful building and a very nice understated interior. Definitely worth a visit !
Not really that impressive. All stained glass is new or non traditional. It was bombed in WWII by Allied planes (June 1944) and there was also a fire in the roof in 1972. 1776.
A fantastic cathedral located in the heart of the city. The color windows are really impressive, as well as the atmosphere. It is truly an iconic of nantes, you have to see it it doesn't take long !
We were delighted with such a beautiful and clean cathedral. We followed the easy visitor guide which drew us to all the major points of interest. Worth a peak in the door.
Very Beautiful Cathedral. The internal arches and pillars are absolutely stunning. The main nave is surrounded by smaller chapels each with its own history.

An interesting place to visit. Not very decorative. Lovely stain glass. We could not get access to the crypt which was disappointing. Gothic architecture
I enjoy the visiting of old buildings and so I loved the visit. I got talking to some fabulous fellow tourists inside randomly too which made hte visit more interesting.

A beautiful cathedral, among the best in France. Dating from the Britanny kingdom age. Close to the castle, this is the heart of the city. Fire in the early seventies, the roof was destroyed. I was there, very emotional to see this big building afire in the night. I cryed!
We had the chance to see the show in december, it is excelent, I enjoyed and I was amazed. France is beautiful in cathedrals, I recommend to visit this one as it is one of the beautiful ones.

My husband and I walked against an jovial crowd as we made our way to watch the L'Odyssee des reves at the Cathedrale de Saint-Pierre et Saint-Paul. The light projections, set to music, on the facade of the cathedral made people of all ages ooh and awe. (Available 23-30 December
Catherdral dates from Viking times. Beautifully restored after a fire, 1972. Contains interesting tombs and history of Nantes.

Cathedral is on the Camino de Santiago de Compostela (to Spain) so make sure you get your credencial stamped here (you can also buy one inside). Everything you'd expect from a grand European Cathedral. Impressive almost seems an understatement.

In the heart of the city, this cathedral has been rebuilt in the second half of the 20th century. It is a magnificent place to hear an organ concert, if you have the opportunity. However, it is worth visiting as either a tourist attraction or as a worship venue on Sunday
This Cathedral is just beautiful. I went there quite late so I couldn't go inside but it is stunning from the outside.
this is a gorgeous ..very expansive....feels like hollowed ground. Beautiful architecture that rivals the well know named cathedrals

Large, well kept Cathedral, Lots of new stained galss windows, I would imagine due to war damage replacement? some original Norman stained glass windows, a couple of important tombs and two very nice widely voiced Pipe Organs.
Combined with a visit to the adjacent Chateau makes a great few hours, it is a fine cathedral with many great windows.
Visited with family, several times. The columns, carvings, tombs, all above expectations. The façade is amazing. Allow at least 20 minutes for a good visit.
The important thing in Nantes, there are really less traffic lights, mostly clean city and the cathedrale visit is a must place.

I visited this beautiful church before going on the little train tour and decided to come back on the Sunday for 10:00 mass. This was a sung mass and the church was almost full. Made of white stones with amazing height and sunlight coming through the stained glass windows,
Amazing building . Free entry . Breathtaking inside well worth a look , you can also get a tourist train outside that is very good and there is a bar called GIGG'S bar opposite which does good food

Head along one of the straight roads into the centre of Nantes, follow the signs to Cathedral parking. The car park is underground and feels very safe. The cathedral is beautiful inside and, of course, entry is free. The chateau is close by and has a very nice café.

Great cathedral with grave Duke of Brittany. They have nice crypts to visit for free. Really worth a visit.

The 2 tumbs were beautiful and so was the naive painting, not what you would expect in a cathedral though.
Stopped by very briefly. Very grand inside. Seems very narrow and tall and has beautiful stained glass windows. Not sure about it's history.

beautiful church which holds the tomb stone of François 2 and his wife. it has been cleaned and restored since the fire of 1992 which makes this huge cathedral bright and full of light and a joy to visit. if you are lucky you might even enjoy a great free concert which are held

There are a lot of amazing cathedrals in France but this one was largely destroyed in WWII and the architecture and modern stain glass windows are breath taking. The main nave is very high and therefore seems narrow, which gives it wonderful proportions.
A dramatic building (re-built many times, most recently in the 1970s). Worth a trip. Visit the crypts for history.

Nice cathedral which was heavily bombed and rebuild. Gothic in style with modern windows the cathedral has not lost its charm. It has a mystical feel and the work done positively renders the work done.

This is a large cathedral and is easy to find since it is close to/in Nantes old town area. The cathedral was built over a five hundred year period staying in the mid-1400's. It is definitely worth an hour of your time when in Nantes.
The Cathedrale is nice inside although less ornate than a lot of others, it is still used for weddings and is worth spending the time to explore.
It is incredib,e that they were able to rebuild such an incredible structure aftr the huge fire in 1972.
This gothic cathedral is magnificent both from the outside and the inside. Inside there are some interesting tombs, amazing stained glass windows.
The lightest and brightest cathedral I've been in, beautiful architecture and stained glass - it's on the green line so worth visiting.
This amazing architectural feat is just beautiful to the eyes, careful to not visit during the mass times so that you aren't restricted to your visit

In our journey thru Loire valley we visited many cathedrals and each of them is particular in one way. This cathedral looks like unfinished and is well-known by wonderful tombs of duke Francis II and his wife.
Stunning example of 16th century gothic, perpendicular architecture. A great testament to mans ingenuity & resilience.
Nantes was full of fascinating buildings, musea, statues etc. The cathedral is one of the best - a huge and peaceful oasis. While tourists are welcome, it has not lost its spiritual essence.
A very interesting cathedral, with beautiful windows and plenty of history. Well worth visiting. We spent quite a while inside admiring the archtecture

I was surprised by the ceilingheight of Cathedrale St-Pierre et St-Paul,s, it seemed like the highest of the many Cathedrals we have visited during our month rouring France, but not mentioned as such. It's big and impressive, very well maintained. It houses the tomb of the last

Acceptable visit, the architecture is majestic but on the inside there are few things you can admire, but not that much..

We walked a bit around the cathedral, trying not to disturb the mass in Progress. It was very beutiful and well renovated, worth taking a walk around as well as seeing from the inside. Free admission and a must-see in Nantes

This is a lovely cathedral and I was lucky enough to enter when the choir was practicing. And yes, it is FULL for Sunday mass. It is, however, FREEZING inside. The tombs are spectacular. Be sure to use the viewing platform - it is easily missed.

Francis II is buried here. He built the Château in Nantes. There has been a cathedral here as far back as the 6th century when St. Felix had it built. There is a St. Felix chapel inside. This version of the cathedral is in Gothic style and was not fully completed Untill 1891.

This is one of the many beautiful historic churches in Nantes. It is vast with beautiful Windows. It is well worth a visit.
Beautiful Cathedral with such an interesting architecture. Not so interesting when the service has started.
Very impressive architecture! Easy to find and very tall. The green line will take you there if you follow it. Lots of detail on the stone work.

Stumbled across this place on a wonder about the old town of Nantes. It's set a little back from the main streets, but towers over everything. Had to go and look inside! Inside you are immediately struck but the sheet height of the vaulted ceilings. The place is kept very clean
Beautiful cathedral in the heart of Nantes. funny how there is a70s era clock on the front. Check the sculptures inside.

We had about 2 hours so we ran from our hotel to this cathedral and it was very beautiful. There were lots of signs telling its history but in French!! so we didn't understand.

This is one of the best cathedrals I've seen in my travels over the years, I will say do not be in a rush though and enjoy the quiet atmosphere.

We wanted to see the wonderful tombs of Francis II and his duchess, and weren't disappointed. The building is unusual in that it so white and clean: a consequence of the rebuilding after the fire in the 1970s.

This is a wonderful place to visit. The building was flattened in the war and the re-built structure was badly damaged in a fire relatively recently. The new white stone is a revelation, it looks exactly as it did when it was built hundreds of years ago!

Beautiful cathedral, the stain glass windows are worthy of the visit, the ambiance inside the cathedral is of much respect

The Cathedral is well conserved and is still lively with a large variety of masterpieces (statutes, paints and decorative elements). You just have to follow the green line to go there and there is facily of public transport.

The architecture of this Cathedrale was amazing! The intricate details on the front were spectacular. The inside of the Cathedrale was very pretty and the stain glass windows were very impressive. The best bit? It was very quiet so you could take time to admire the building
What a beautiful cathedral which was amazing inside! Well worth a visit and really unusual stained glass.
Lovely, beautiful architecture. You can't miss it, it can be seen for miles. We didn't spend too much time, and just walked around inside.
Imposing building with high ceiling, clean and elegant lines and very bright interior. The crypt is well worth the visit with some fine displays of cathedral’s and Nantes’ history.
Stunning and interesting building close to the chateau. Gives a good overview to the history of Nantes

Lovely cathedral filled with light, very pleasant visit, and there is a free display of historical cathedral artefacts in the crypt, as well as a display on the history of the cathedral. Particularly nice on a hot afternoon as it's so cool down there.
It's nice and beautiful outside of the church. And very high ceiling. If you are traveling here don't forget to look inside.
Very pretty with amazingly high ceilings and extremely bright inside. Definately with a stroll inside to see.

This beautiful gothic cathedral has the most stunning stained glass windows. The cathedral is warm and inviting and almost seems modern due to its bright appearance. We were able to watch a young lady power washing one of the altar carvings to restore it to pristine condition.

a big cathdral, with spectacular architecture, however there was a fire in 1972 and it seems that many items from the original dcor wer lost, making the visit less enjoyable
Visiting the Cathedral was not what we expected. We normally visit churches and cathedrals in our holiday, this was one which we could have skipped. Not as special as we thought.

On arrival, the organ was being played. Sounded amazing. Lots of small chapels. Alter was very simple and modern. Lovely fresh lilies scented the air. Very quiet and peaceful.

text.wiki:
The Musée Jules Verne is a museum dedicated to the French writer Jules Verne. It is located in the city of Nantes, France, and was opened in 1978 to mark the 150th anniversary of Verne's birth.


== Description ==

The museum is housed in a late 19th century building overlooking the Loire River. While Verne never lived in the building, its surroundings reflect the atmosphere which influenced his work. His parents had a house in nearby Bas-Chantenay.The museum has a collection of artifacts, replicas of his inventions, and memorabilia inspired by his writings. The museum is divided into eight themed rooms:

Jules Verne's drawing room; featuring chairs and the clock from his own drawing room. His china on display in the room was donated to the City of Nantes by Verne's descendants. Throughout his career, Verne received the china as gifts from foreign journalists.
The start of dreams
The sea, the sea
The two Jules
Known and unknown worlds
The Voyagers on stage
Reading and games room
Audiovisual roomThe building was renovated in 2005, the centenary of Verne's death.


== Location ==
The museum is located at 3, rue de l'Hermitage, Nantes.


== Gallery ==

		


== References ==


== External links ==
Official website
Musée Jules Verne on Nantes Tourist Office website

All sorts of printing machines, which for the most part, are in operation. Examples of lithographs, typesetting machines, up to early photocomposition. Unusual things such as the moulds for biscuits (Nantes is famous for Petit Beurre and others). Very forthcoming and friendly

A mechanical elephant that adults can ride! It spouts out vapour from it's trunk as it moves along. A big hit with the adults and kids!

This is a place not to be missed in Nantes, if only for its uniqueness. We rode the elephant, although it is just as much fun to march along next to it!

We have been to Nantes before but the Machines de L'Ile is a new attraction since our last visit. We researched when to go online as the carousel only opens certain times and certain days. It is also a little pricey at €8.90 per person for two rides on the Carousel and another

Do not miss it and make sure you ride the elephant and go on the carousel. Also buy a tourist pass for value for money

We rode the famous mechanical elephant and visited the carousel as well. We all really enjoyed ourselves and even purchased a print to frame when we got back home. Some great bars and restaurants close by too.

The machines show how man can use his imagination to develop and copy nature but not improve. A very impressive place to visit.
Visited with my two young toddlers who loved the elephant and carousel. Awesome architecture in this part of Nantes too! The nearby moon trampoline park was a big hit with all the family.

Wow. Just blew me away this place. The design. The incredibly cool machines, the sheer scale of things. Just incredible. I was blown away by the fun and the attention to detail. I have to visit again, didn't have time to see it all. So cool!! Highly recommended, try to go early,

All the Machines are awesome!! It is impressive to see all the work behind them, starting from the amazing designs and finishing with the nice style. The spirit of Julio Verne can be felt behind all the machines! It deserves a visit!!!

Very disappointing and not worth the bother. Much better ways to spend your time in this beautiful city than going to see a mechanical elephant and the few other modest 'attractions' on offer here.
What a wonderful day, it was amazing. Such a lot to do and see, great for children and adults alike. The elephant was the highlight of the trip,

Just in the town, on the old docks, all in french, but the elephant ,,,, crazy, plus the biggest carousel

It is interesting for children but a little overpriced. Stuff are nice but the boutique is a little expensive

If you visit Nantes then this is a must visit.The machines are incredible and are fascinating for all ages and the rides on the Carousel are all sea creatures and wonderfully fanatstic, like something from Jules Verne

Visited this attraction last year with friends and it was brilliant. Although I couldn't go on the elephant due to ill health, it was brilliant to watch our friends on it. Les Machines are housed in a futuristic type of air shelter. It's a ten minute walk from the tram line

We have been a number of times, always a mini spectaculer. Well worth the visit. You can, at a cost, ride the elephant and your trip includes a stop at the carousel included. The attached "museum/workshop" is a bit expensive for what it is. Interesting but "worth the entry fee?"

This place is spectacular for the child and adult. This machines are like transformers, for me.......

Incerdible when you see the mechanic elephant walk around. The carrousel is really a "need to see" and when you go on the carroussels sea/air annimals you are part of the machinery (in a good sense) ;-)

We had a great time on the elephant and the roundabout. A fun place to visit, with or without children.
A must if going to Nantes. The machines and elephant are fantastic to see and made exactly like they would have done in the Victorian era. So unusual with so much detail and quirkiness.
It is a great place to visit on weekends with every age group. Children love it and adults have fun too. It is a world of fantasy and adventure and wonderful imagination.

An amazing mechanical themed attraction with a Jules Verne feel. The huge mechanical elephant was mesmerising!

Nowhere else will you find such an abstract and unusual theme park. My sister is a teenage and was rather reluctant to go however she really enjoyed the carousel and the museum. A must-see attraction.

Great experience. Interesting to see all the mechanical parts in motion. Book in advance as limited spaces. Free entry to view workshop area a new projects.
